page.title: 07 Gypsum Mining
page.content: Gypsum is mined at Fauld.It is a white rock and quite soft. The mine and the mill are completely mechanised and give jobs to 260 people.It also provides jobs for haulage people. They produce 6000 tonnes of bagged plaster a week and 12000 tonnes of other products. Chalk is also made from gypsum.The rain water that seeps through gypsum is used for brewing beer.That is probably why it is the best beer in the world. Alabaster is a hard form of gypsum. It can be carved into attractive statues and ornaments. In 1894 an order of 18 alabaster blocks was carried out. the alabaster was used for building a mansion in New York. It was being built for Cornelius Vanderbilt.Some of the blocks weighed 15 tonnes each.They were cut by hand loaded and transported out of the mine by horse and cart.
